intro: Plagiolirion, commonly known as the bent-lip orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their unique, often fragrant flowers that feature a distinctive lip or labellum. Plagiolirion species typically grow in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Their flowers are usually small to medium in size and come in a variety of colors, including white, yellow, and pink. Due to their specific habitat requirements, many species of Plagiolirion are threatened by habitat loss and are of interest to botanists and conservationists.
